title: Gaja 2014 Sorì San Lorenzo  (Barbaresco)
description: Forest floor, Porcini mushroom, eucalyptus, dark spice and toasted aromas curl out of the glass. It's youthfully austere, offering cranberry, sour cherry and licorice framed in assertive, close-grained tannins. It still needs time to come around and fully bloom. Drink 2024–2034.

title: F X Pichler 2016 Ried Liebenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
description: This wine's unlikely combination of passion fruit, wild thyme, lemon zest and fennel seed aromas is totally convincing. On the palate, that same richness is even more apparent. Savory herb and salt notes seem counter a richer, oilier citrus aspect, making for high drama and lots of flavor. Sip, sit back and savor the long, citrus-inflected finish.

title: Geyerhof 2016 Ried Kirchensteig Riesling (Kremstal)
description: This wine's tender yellow apple notes have an edge of orange and grapefruit zest. Tingling green apple freshness pervades the palate, along with lemon zest notes and a flowing, generous juiciness that almost lets you forget how pithy the flavors actually are. Very streamlined, linear and dry, with a lip-smakcing finish and lots of future promise. Drink 2018–2030.

title: Jäger 2016 Ried Steinriegl Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)
description: A hedonistic touch of juicy peach swings along with the lemon notes on the nose of this wine. That lovely creamy peachiness also makes for a happy flavor tandem with lemon on the taut, concentrated palate, adding texture and echo. The finish returns to pure, lasting lemon. What a joy. Drink 2018–2030.

title: Jean-Marc Burgaud 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)
description: Reveling in the tannins of a young Côte du Py, this wine is rich, structured and dense. The tannins give the dry edge this wine needs to age. Intense with ripe black fruits, this is a powerful wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Johanneshof Reinisch 2016 Satzing Rotgipfler (Thermenregion)
description: This wine's nutty, rounded richness and hint of woodsmoke glint in the glass. Its intense citrus freshness, which recalls lemon and orange oil, is tempered by a slight smoky edge. Rotgipfler is one of Austria's rarer indigenous grapes, and this one is particularly unusual, intense and concentrated. It's a party in a glass that's lovely now but will develop. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Jurtschitsch 2016 Ried Schenkenbichl Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: This wine's fresh green apple notes vie with green Conference pear scents while a flinty touch of reduction promises longevity. The palate shimmers with miso, sage and bright, pure lemon notes, which emphasize darker tones of savory yeast. The combination is totally moreish and effective.

title: K Vintners 2014 Cattle King Upland Vineyard Syrah (Snipes Mountain)
description: Consistently one of the winery's top bottlings, aromas of blackberry, black plum, dried herb, anise and spice are followed by supremely rich, tightly wound black fruit and crème de cassis flavors that show a firm grainy handshake of tannins and a warm crazy-long finish. It's all about intensity of expression but what intensity it brings.

title: K Vintners 2014 Ovide Jack's Vineyard Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Coming from a vineyard in the Rocks District, aromas of kirsch, black currant, tobacco, spice and mineral are followed by saturated, rich black fruit and smoked meat flavors. It packs a powerful delicious punch.

title: K Vintners 2014 Powerline Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This new exciting vineyard is located in the foothills of the Blue Mountains and is filled with cobblestone soils. The aromas explode with notes of raspberry, green and black olive brine, green stem, smoked meat, mineral and earth. The palate is rich and focused, with intense earth, fruit and savory flavors that lead to an extended finish. Abundant floral notes are speckled throughout. It's a stunner.

title: Lesehof Stagård 2016 Steiner Hund Riesling (Kremstal)
description: The yeasty smell of lees is still present on the nose of this wine, and its lemony fruit struggles to come through. On the palate, however, bright, brisk and pure lemon is in full force. Fruitiness and bitter pith are interwoven, creating a textured mouthfeel of fresh and tart flavors. This still needs to knit together but promises to be a long-lived, concentrated Riesling. Drink now until 2030 or longer.

title: Lesehof Stagård 2016 Steiner Schreck Riesling (Kremstal)
description: The funkiness of lees and fermentation dominate this wine's aroma. On the palate, fresh green and red apple notes shine through, along with a vibrant, pure streak of lemon freshness. It's concentrated yet slender, needing time to show its lemony poise. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Madrigal 2013 Final Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a warm welcoming wine, resolved in tannin and well-integrated overall. Black licorice, tobacco and clove add to the savory depth of dark, brooding character as an unexpected waft of violet perfume lurks beneath the full-bodied ripeness and concentration.

title: Merry Edwards 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from grapes sourced from several sites across the appellation, this shows deft winemaking skill in its velvety, gritty texture and beautiful aromas and flavors of cured meat, rose petal and Asian five spice. Bright acidity lifts the tones of cranberry, rhubarb and mushroom earthiness, with a touch of crushed stone.

title: Neumeister 2013 Stradener Alte Reben Sauvignon Blanc (Vulkanland Steiermark)
description: Soft vanilla tones overlay fresh, bright passion fruit and rich vanilla notes in this wine, but something more intense lies beneath. The palate reveals great concentration, freshness and intensity, with passion fruit, cream and lemon flavors. Despite the creamy descriptors this is resolutely svelte—a real marvel of what mature vines can do. The finish is dry, intense and very long. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Nittnaus Anita und Hans 2015 Altenberg Blaufränkisch (Leithaberg)
description: The nose is shy but with air it gives way to ripe but tart plum and cherry fruit. On the palate this broadens out into the aromatic hit of Morello and Amarena, kept in tight check by a fine web of gossamer tannins and fresh, bright acidity. This is dense but not extracted, toned but not bulky. This very honestly presented red comes across as totally elegant and wonderfully understated. Impressive but certainly not showy. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Produttori del Barbaresco 2013 Ovello Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Wild berry, camphor, moist earth and violet aromas unfold in the glass. The structured, refined palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, orange slice and white pepper alongside polished tannins and bright acidity. A soothing licorice note lingers on the finish. Drink through 2028.

title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2016 Ried Heiligenstein Riesling (Kamptal)
description: An aromatic cloud of orange and lemon zest rises from the glass. With air, the citrus notions become more heady and intense. They perform the same trick on the palate, shimmering in an aromatic array of bergamot, lemon, tangerine and orange. There's a vein of freshness, unforced concentration and the promise of a long future ahead. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Tegernseerhof 2016 Ried Höhereck Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
description: This wine's ripe, yellow pear aromas have a savory touch of miso. On the palate, a pleasantly bitter note of citrus pith takes over, adding freshness and texture to complement the savory flavors that give it so much intrigue. It would be simply impossible to not take another sip. The finish is clean, taut and moreish.

title: Wohlmuth 2015 Ried Edelschuh Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)
description: An unusual flavor combination of hazelnut and passion fruit marks the nose of this wine. On the palate, these two poles—one of tart freshness, the other of textured richness—intertwine even more. This simply needs time to come into its full glory: an oak-aged Sauvignon Blanc of immense freshness, concentration and lees-driven richness. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Castello di Amorosa 2016 Morning Dew Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Bold and spicy, this firmly built wine is the first Morning Dew Ranch vineyard-designate from the new owners of the estate. It starts with exotic and enticing aromas of fresh mint, basil and clove, then delivers pure, focused black fruits and a generous dose of new-oak spice on the palate. Healthy, lip-smacking tannins and firm acidity give it great structure, yet there's no hurry to enjoy this wine. Best after 2020.

title: Trapl 2015 Reserve St. Laurent (Carnuntum)
description: Tender notes of cherry inform the nose of this translucent St Laurent. The palate is gentle and taut, favoring aromatic cherry notes and straying far more into freshness and grace than power. A subtle spine of tannin stays in the background and lets the elegance of this wine to shine.

title: Domaines Dominique Piron 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)
description: This young wine has great potential. It shows weight and a powerful tannic structure as well as bold, ripe black fruits. Coming from the top sector of Morgon, the wine has concentration and richness. It needs to age, and won't be ready before 2019.

title: Eder 2016 Raubern Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
description: The pear fruit on the nose of this wine is so heady and pristine it almost comes across as candied. It continues on the palate, where it's joined by a fluid and creamy texture, with hints of citrus pith and salt. An intriguing, elegant and taut package. The finish is long and recalls pure lemon zest.

title: Eichinger 2016 Ried Lamm Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: A touch of yeasty savor appears on the subdued nose of this wine. On the palate, everything seems elevated and poised: there is concentration and texture as well as creamy lemon freshness, deeply savory yeast notes and a salty, herbal tang. This is little pleasure bomb waiting to unfold. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Erasmo 2010 Late Harvest Torontel (Maule Valley)
description: A sublime set of caramel and honeyed late-harvest aromas couldn't be more inviting. This Torontel is the best dessert wine from Chile. It's intense and pure, with acidic balance. Rich amplified flavors of caramel, toffee and cocoa finish with grace on the finish. This is like a trip to Europe: think Vin Santo or Vendange Tardive.

title: Fischer 2016 Privat Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
description: A ripe, tropical pineapple vibe adds richness to the more customary fruit notes of pear in this wine. The palate broadens into rich, savory miso flavors and leesy texture before being countered by lively, pervading lemon freshness. A big, dramatic wine with incisive brightness. Drink 2029–2030.

title: Furthermore 2014 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very pretty and precise on the nose, this bottling, which is quite delicate for the rich-leaning region, shows candied pomegranate, cinnamon spice, hibiscus and wet gravel on the nose. Wild strawberry and rhubarb flavors pop on the sip, alongside watermelon rind and a very rocky and tense minerality. There is tons of tannic and acidic depth.

title: Gernot and Heike Heinrich 2015 Blaufränkisch (Leithaberg)
description: Fresh, almost pristine black cherry beckons from the glass, followed by a gentle whiff of woodsmoke. The medium-bodied palate has the same combination of pristine freshness and gentle oak, showing fresh-faced fruit laced by whisper tannins and delineated by vivid acidity. This is a wonderfully elegant wine with a real force of life inside it. Drink now–2030.

title: Hiedler 2016 Ried Gaisberg Reserve Riesling (Kamptal)
description: Citrus foliage, conifer resin and pure lemon zest aromas create an enticing nose in this wine. On the linear palate, riper Mandarin and Meyer lemon notions take hold, creating an immensely juicy, zesty sensation. It's refreshing now, but if you can resist drinking it right away, it will develop beautifully. Drink 2018–2028.
